page.title: 05LOVERSALL HALL
page.content: The Tudor manor house at Loversall was pulled down in the early 18th century by its owner James Fenton, who owned 2,000 acres at the time. This was replaced on the same plot of land by Loversall Hall which he made his principal residence. This Georgian styled residence was a two storeyed building which still stands largely unchanged. It was set in a garden of great beauty amidst 17.5 acres of charming parkland. In 1967 Loversall Hall and its 8 acres of land were taken over by Malcolm Colbear and his advertising agency. There are 24 people employed in the hall. Mr Colbear himself uses what once was the master bedroom as his office whilst a Â£40,000 computer sits where once the mistress of Loversall Hall slept.
